newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent sideways, drifting with ACCESS trade.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent sideways, drifting with ACCESS trade.

text.p: SIMEX June Brent crude futures were quoted sideways from its London's close with trade expected to drift, tracking ACCESS, brokers said on Thursday.
June Brent on SIMEX was quoted at $18.00/$18.17 per tonne, sideways from its last close at $18.16 on the IPE, which rose just three cents in late U.S activity.
July was last quoted at $18.12/$18.27 against London's close of $18.22.
June cash Brent was notionally assessed at $18.10/$18.20 per barrel.
Brokers said market is listless after the released of the U.S oil data and is seeking fresh factors.
"Talk is very light at the moment," one broker said.
NYMEX June crude was last traded on ACCESS at $19.65, up three cents from New York's close on Wednesday
